assort_mix.description: Assortative mixing definitions, the key must be an attribute of the Agent class.

attribute.description: Which Agent attribute to assort on

agent_value.description: Value of agent's attribute which triggers using this rule

partner_values.description: Which partners to select if assortative mixing happens. Expects a sub-key of an attribute value with a value of the probability. `__other__` can be used as an attribute value as a fallthrough option.  All of the probabilities should add to one.

act.description: Scales number of injection acts during syringe-based transmission
Scales number of sex acts during sex trasmission

mortality.description: Scaling factor for all cause mortality rates

incarceration.description: Scaling factor for probability of becoming incarcerated

buffer.description: Scaling factor for number of partners able to take on when other agents are looking to partner

break_point.description: How many failed attempts an agent can have at partnering in a given round before removing them from the eligible pool

transmission.description: Scaling factor for effictiveness of ART therapy on transmission probability

coverage.description: Scaling factor for enrollment on ART probability

prob.description: Probability an agent's relationships will be trimmed if using max_k_comp_size for network initialization

races.description: Which races to use in model (currently only 'WHITE' and 'BLACK' supported)

sex_types.description: Which sex types to use in model

bond_types.description: Types of bonds relationships can have

drug_types.description: Types of drugs that an agent can use in the model

populations.description: Which demographic populations to track in addition to sex_types

demographics.description: Parameters controlling population class level probabilities and behaviors

ppl.description: Percentage of agent population with given parent key that is this class.  Across races this must add up to one, and at the sex type level within a race, this must also add up to one. Other demographic params can have proportions of any value.

versatile.description: Percentage of agents in this class with 'versatile' sex role

insertive.description: Percentage of agents in this class with 'insertive' sex role

receptive.description: Percentage of agents in this class with 'receptive' sex role

init.description: Probability that an agent in this class initially has HIV
Probability that an agent with HIV is initially diagnosed and 'knows' their HIV status, therefore enabling enrollment in treatment

prob.description: Probability that an agent with HIV becomes diagnosed at a given time step and 'knows' their HIV status, therefore enabling enrollment in treatment

transmission.description: Scaling factor for transmission probability by race (only effective at race level)

init.description: Probability that an agent in this class with HIV has AIDS initially
Probability that an agent in this class with HIV is initially enrolled in HAART

prob.description: Probability that an agent in this class with HIV becomes enrolled in HAART at a given time step

adherence.description: Probability that an agent is assigned adherence of 5, otherwise randomly assigned 1-4

discontinue.description: Probability that an agent on HAART discontinues HAART in a given time step
Probability that an agent enrolled in ssp drops out in a given time step

init.description: Probability that an agent in this class is initially incarcerated

prob.description: Probability that an agent in this class becomes incarcerated at a given time step
Binned probabilities of incarceration duration during model run

init.description: Binned probabilities of incarceration duration when initializing population

num_partners.description: Mean number of partners for an agent in this class if using model.population.num_partners.type = poisson

num_acts.description: Mean number of injection acts done within a relationship

unsafe_prob.description: Probability of sharing a syringe per act

safe_sex.description: Probability of safe sex (condom use) per sex act

discontinue.description: Probability that an agent on PrEP discontinues PrEP at a given time step

adherence.description: Probability that an agent on PrEP is assigned an adherence of 1, otherwise assigned 0

coverage.description: Target percentage of PrEP coverage for this population class

init.description: Probability that an agent is initially marked as high risk
Probability that an agent is initially vaccinated

prob.description: Probability that an agent becomes vaccinated at a given time step

interval.description: Number of time steps from vaccination at which booster vaccine is required

prob.description: Probability of an agent getting booster vaccine at required time step

age.description: Binned probabilities of ages by race, last bin should be 1 to have default

base.description: Death rate by race per 1000 person years in base case

hiv.description: Death rate by race per 1000 person years if hiv+ (but no aids)

aids.description: Death rate by race per 1000 person years if aids

incar.description: Whether incarceration will be used in the model

prep.description: Whether PrEP will be used in the model

high_risk.description: Whether high risk will be used in the model

haart.description: Whether haart will be used in the model

die_and_replace.description: Whether agents can die in the model, if so they will be replaced

static_network.description: Whether the network is static across time, i.e., no bonds formed or broken after initialization.

agent_zero.description: Whether to create 4 "agent_zeros" to initialize HIV in the population

assort_mix.description: Whether to use assortative mixing by classes other bond type compatibility when partnering

vaccine.description: Whether to use a vaccine in the model

partner_tracing.description: Whether to trace a newly diagnosed agent's partners, so that they become diagnosed at the next time step

msmw.description: Whether to have agents that are men who sleep with men and women - it is not quite a sex type, but adjusts their risks and probabilities accordingly

pca.description: Whether to have peer change agents spreading awareness of PrEP

syringe_services.description: Whether to have a syringe services program in the model

partner_scale.description: Linear increase to partner number during high risk period

prob.description: Probability an agent whose partner is incarcerated enters high risk group

condom_use_type.description: Which type of factor to use when determining condom usage

sex_based.description: Duration of high risk for each sex_type

duration.description: Number of time steps an agent of this sex type is high risk

sex.description: risk redection in sex transmission probability for diagnosed agents

injection.description: risk reduction in sex transmission probability for diagnosed agents

infectivity.description: Infectivity multiplier ratio for acute status infections

duration.description: Number of time steps an agent is in acute status

prob.description: Probability of an agent with hiv progressing to aids at a given time step (scaled by haart adherence)

max_init_time.description: On creation, agents are randomly assigned an hiv_time, this is the maximum time

dx.description: Probability an agent with HIV who is incarcerated gets diagnosed while in prison

multiplier.description: How many times more likely is an agent with HIV to become incarcerated

prob.description: Probability an agent who is incarcerated is enrolled in haart

adherence.description: Probability an agent who is incarcerated is adherent

discontinue.description: Probability an agent who is incarcerated discontinues haart

processes.description: Number of processes in parallel to use for computation

run.description: Seed for random number generator for running the model. 0 is pure random, -1 for stepwise through number of number of iterations (num_reps), other numbers will be used to explicitly set the seed.

ppl.description: Seed for random number generator for creating the population. 0 is pure random, other numbers will be used to explicitly set the seed. -1 for stepwise through number of monte carlo iterations (-n flag on command line).

num_reps.description: Number of times to repeat simulation, if run seed is set to -1, it will step through run seeds during simulation

num_steps.description: Number of time steps to run the model

steps_per_year.description: How many time steps are completed per year (e.g. 12 is equivalent to a monthly time step, and 52 would be weekly)

burn_steps.description: Number of time steps of burn in period, if 0, there is no burn in period.

enable.description: Whether to use a formal graph to model the network, only needed if using network functionality such as centrality or bridging or to use an initialization algorithm from this section of parameters. scale_free does not require a formal graph and is the default if graph is not enabled

max.description: Largest allowable size of a sub-graph in the network at initialization with max_k_comp_size

type.description: How to determine the mean number of partners for an agent

bins.description: Binned probabilities of number of partners

prob.description: Probability of HM who is MSMW additionally converting to HIV

print_frequency.description: How frequently to update the component states, visualization, network stats reports during  a run

draw_figures.description: Whether to plot the network during the run of a model

edge_list.description: Whether to write the graph's edge list during the run of a model

calc_network_stats.description: Whether to write the network statistics during the run of a model

calc_component_stats.descriptions: Whether to calculate and save statistics on network components during model run

reports.description: Which reports to save from run of the model

dx.description: Probability that an agent who is traced and has hiv gets diagnosed with hiv - default is  TP / (TP + FN)

prob.description: Probability that an agent whose partner is diagnosed with hiv will become traced

duration.description: Binned probabilities of length of a partnership's sexual durations

frequency.description: Binned probabilities of number of sex acts of a partnership at a given time step

haart_scaling.description: Scaling factor on HIV transmission for a given haart adherence

acquisition.description: Probability of HIV negative partner acquiring HIV given their preferred sex position

versatile.description: Probability for hiv acquisition for a given sex type for versatile role

insertive.description: Probability hiv acquisition for a given sex type for insertive role

receptive.description: Probability for hiv acquisition for a given sex type for receptive role

frequency.description: Binned probabilities of frequency of a partnership's syringe sharing

transmission.description: Binned probabilities of transmission from syringe sharing given haart adherence

interaction.description: Binned probabilities by relationship type of interaction at a given time step

default.description: Binned probabilities of interaction at a given time step

bonds.description: Probabilities by population for bond type

ongoing_duration.description: Relationship duration past which the relationship is considered "ongoing".  Used for CDCWomen and CDCmsm prep eligibility.

type.description: Type of PrEP used in model

target.description: Target coverage for PrEP therapy at 10 years

start.description: Timestep at which prep should start in the model

adherent.description: Probability of PrEP efficacy if agent is adherent

non_adherant.description: Probabilty of PrEP efficacy if agent is non-adherent

discontinue.description: The probabability that an agent on PrEP discontinues PrEP at a given time step

target_model.description: which model to use to determine who is enrolled in PrEP

half_life.description: Half life in days of injectable PrEP, used to calculate agent's prep load

peak_load.description: Maximum prep load that an agent can have (load at injection time step)

prob.description: Probability of getting long acting injectable prep

init.description: Probability of Agent awareness of PrEP at time zero

prob.description: Probability an agent becomes aware of PrEP
Probability of attempting * chance of initiating oral or inj PrEP

threshold.description: Opinion needed to initiate PrEP on a 0-4 scale (translated from 1-5 scale)

transmission.description: Per-act probability of opinion change in less-prominent partner
Per-act probability of knowledge change in unaware partner

prob.description: Probablility that a network component is assigned to the treatment arm of the trial

start.description: What time to start this prevalence of syringe services program

stop.description: What time to stop this prevalence of syringe services program

num_slots.description: Cap for number of available slots in SSP

risk.description: Risk of unsafe sharing for agents enrolled in the SSP

type.description: type of vaccine to use, affects transmission probability

start.description: Time step at which to start vaccination

init.description: Whether to initialize the population with vaccination
